name: Want to be a better speaker?
description: What is Toastmasters? Toastmasters is an international organization with over 250,000 members worldwide consisting of almost 13,000 clubs in 106 countries. Since 2010, Malm√∂ has had a Toastmasters club of its own, with meetings in English. What Does Toastmasters Do? Well, we have nothing to do with roasting bread or breakfast. Instead Toastmasters has grown to become a world leader in helping people become more competent and comfortable in front of an audience. Communications, public speaking and leadership skills can all be found in abundance at your normal Toastmasters meeting. Why Toastmasters? If you are in a position where you need to communicate, and who of us isn‚Äôt, Toastmasters can help. The self paced program, the members, and the global organization provide all the support you need to achieve whatever goal it is you have at a fraction of the cost of a normal one day communications course. From engineers to entertainers, government workers to entrepreneurs, Toastmasters members represent a wide range of people who are committed to working towards a common goal in a supportive, professional atmosphere. Plus, we are a lot of fun! Sounds Great! How do I get started? Of course it does! If you would like more information please check out our website at http://www.malmo.toastmasters.se/ or e-mail us at malmo@toastmasters.se . As a member organization, guests are always welcome to take a test drive before jumping in to what could be one of the most rewarding decisions you have ever made. Hope to see you soon at a Malm√∂ Toastmasters meeting! Agenda: 17.45- Meet & Greet 18.00- Presentation 18.30- Meet & Eat 19.00- Q&A

name: Monday Meetup
description: The MindLAB Collective invites you to experiment with Neural Interfaces and other biosensors.Is there any sensory augmentation you would you like to design for your self or for somebody you care about? Let‚Äôs brainstorm!And if you never heard of this technology, this is the right place to start. Already have an idea or something you want to test, contact us to secure a openBCI ganglion board - we don‚Äôt have unlimited hardware yet - and bring your own laptop to have more fun:)No prior experience is required, just come and play. Meetups are organised by Quantum Thinkers! Where? STPLN, Stapelb√§ddsgatan 3, Malm√∂When? Mondays, kl. 17.00Who? any BCIcurious human - augmented cyborgs are also welcomeMore questions? email [masked]

name: Internet of Brain Seminar @ FooCafe Malm√∂
description: Internet of Brain (IoB) is here: a global set of protocols and agreements will connect our brains to digital services online as well as to other brains, triggering the next communication revolution. Like it happened for Internet, the project has been prototyped by the army, some universities has been involved as well as some tech giants corporations. Also, a public proposal is underway. We will take a look at these projects from a architectural-design point of view and learn how do they work. We will take a look at the public proposal and talk about how to contribute and build together the best user-centered, privacy-aware, Internet of Brain. SpeakerMatteo Mazzanti Agenda17:30 ‚Äì 17:45 ‚Äì Meet & Greet17:45 ‚Äì 18:30 ‚Äì Presentation18:30 ‚Äì 19:00 ‚Äì Meet & Eat19:00 ‚Äì 20:00 ‚Äì Q&A

name: Enterprise digital transformation with Azure DevOps + Infra as code with C#/F#
description: Welcome to another evening with learnings from real life cases using innovative Azure technologies! We have special guests that is everyday working with a really hot topics, Digital Transformation with DevOps and Infrastructure as code automation Session1:Enterprise digital transformation with Azure DevOps ServicesSharing main takeaways from migrating dozens of siloed software development lifecycles into one unified platform, implementing basic DevOps patterns to solve human resources and technical issues. It will be 50/50 about hard skills and soft skills. I will go into details with initial state evaluation, how to select a pilot migration project, what issues to expect, how not to get stuck in the middle of migration and keep on track with DevOps transformation in Enterprise with 30k+ employees.Sessions will also cover how Jira, Jenkins, qtest, teamcity, confluence were replaced by azure DevOps services. Session2:Cloud Infrastructure with C# and F#Modern cloud platforms offer amazing capabilities for application developers. However, cloud services are hard to manage without employing Infrastructure as Code tools for automation. Traditional tools like CloudFormation, ARM templates, and Terraform use text-based formats, which tend to be tedious, repetitive, and cumbersome to reuse. What if instead of configuration files, you could use your favourite programming languages like C# and F#? In this talk, Mikhail will introduce you to Pulumi, which uses actual code to manage infrastructure! See how you can bring your developer tools like code completion, types, components, and abstractions to cloud infrastructure definition. Speaker1:Speaker Yegor Lopatin, a cloud computing passionate IT engineer who is now helping people, helping people. Speaker has wide experience in implementing DevOps practices working outsourced, outstaffed, in-house employed; from East Europe to West Coast, and always having fun Twitter (@LopYeg): Speaker2:Mikhail Shilkov is a software developer at Pulumi, enabling developers and operators to work better together. Mikhail is a Microsoft Azure MVP, a Russian expat living in the Netherlands. He is passionate about the serverless mindset, leveraging the full variety of managed cloud services, and handling cloud infrastructure as code. You can find his blog at Preliminary Schedule:17.30 - 17.45 Introduction17.45 - 18.45 Enterprise digital transformation with Azure DevOps Services18.45 - 19.15 Break & Pizza19.15 - 20.00 Cloud Infrastructure with C# and F# - Pulumi *Important*The event is free, but you have to register both here and on Foo Caf√©: A big welcome!Sk√•ne Azure User Group#AzureSkane

name: Use this! Test that! Package everything!
description: It you repeat the same code twice - write a function! If you re-use the same function twice - write a package: In this workshop we will gain some practical skills on packaging your work for testing, sharing and just for fun! We will learn how to make a package in just 15 minutes, and discuss questions related to testing, deployment and marketing your work. Bring a laptop, good mood and a lots of questions. About the speaker: Dmytro Perepolkin is an PhD student at Centre for Environmental and Climate Research, Lund University. He is a passionate R user, open source contributor and educator. Dmytro helped organize Oslo UseR Group and taught at the Carpentries events in Norway and Sweden. name: Meeting 0x12 - Parallel Mergesort with Cuda

venue.name: Foo Cafe

description: Meetup of the Malm√∂ C++ User Group. Signup Here! This months C++ meeting will be presented by Fabian. GPUs allow programmers to launch thousands of threads and run software in a massively parallel fashion. During this talk, we will discuss both the software interface and hardware architecture of CUDA cards. Based on this discussion, we investigate how to re-write the time-honored mergesort algorithm. name: A suspenseful evening @ Prodata
description: With Xmas and new years over and done with, it is high time to get the JS year going. On Tuesday February 25th we kick things off with a meetup hosted by ProData! Come one, come all, partake in free knowledge, tasty food and good company! We have two talks lined up; first Marco Pegoraro will demonstrate how to rapidly prototype a backend-driven web app using Postgres, Hasura, GraphQL, ApolloClient and React Ionic. Then, after some sustenance ingestion, Marc Klefter will do a deep dive into React's upcoming Concurrent Mode. The focus will be the new Suspense API, and how it facilitates the architecture around data fetching. Agenda: 17:30 - Doors open, meet & greet18:00 - Welcoming statement18:15 - Talk 1: Prototyping at Scale, Marco Pegoraro18:45 - Meet & eat19:15 - Talk 2: Data fetching with React Suspense, Marc Klefter19:45 - Q & A20:00 - Doors close Please RSVP ahead of time if possible so we know how much food to conjure forth. Well met on Tuesday February 25th in downtown Malm√∂!
how_to_find_us: ProData's Malm√∂ office is at Entrepren√∂rsCenter S√∂dertull on S√∂dra Vallgatan 5, very close to Gustav Adolfs torg. An equidistant short walk from Malm√∂ C or Malm√∂ Triangeln!

name: IKEA Tech Meetup #2 - Malm√∂ - Studio
description: We are fascinated by the idea of applying technology to create a better everyday life for the many people. Join us for our monthly IKEA Tech Meetup to learn more about the technologies that power IKEA behind the scenes to reach our 3+ billion annual visitors. You can expect a fun event full of learning, deep discussions and a lot of mingling, where we will share and learn from each other. And yes, there will be finger food and drinks ‚Äì how else to mingle without it. DevOps and engineering practise were topics wished by our January meetup participants. We invited, therefore, two IKEA practitioners. Our first speaker is Albert Bertilsson. Albert is a senior product owner for Search with a passion for development and chocolate. He will speak about ‚ÄúTesting in production‚Äù and share, how a team reduced time to market, reduced risk to go to production and, as a bonus, got a system that can selfheal. Our second speaker is Daniel Grenner, who is a senior DevOps engineer in the Retail Range and Merchandising area. Daniel has a broad background within software development, including working as a Software Developer, Release Manager, Scrum Master and Service Manager. He loves to automate boring and repetitive tasks so that the team can spend time on the fun, creative and value-adding parts. Daniel will share experiences from introducing and improving DevOps practices in several teams in IKEA. He will also show a practical way forward if you want to do a similar thing in your teams. This can help you to start your DevOps journey, or find out what your next steps could be. We open the doors at 17.00 and at 17.30 the first session begins.The doors close at 20.45 - leaving you hopefully with great learning, new friends and curiosity to explore even more of IKEA technologies and challenges together. When this sounds interesting for you, be quick: RSVP your seat.The event is free of charge and tickets fly off fast. If you cannot make it, be fair. Please update your RSVP, so that someone else can join instead. We have space for ca. 60 curious people. Warm welcome!
how_to_find_us: Once you arrive at Studio Meetingpoint, follow our signs and find us in room Satellit. Bring your good mood, your experience and an open mind. Studio Meetingpoint by Altitude Meetings Nordenski√∂ldsgatan 24 211 19 Malm√∂

name: SaaS & Wine
description: Let‚Äôs have us SaaS founders and enthusiasts in Malm√∂ meet over a glass of wine (or beer or whatever you fancy), some aperitivo and discuss challenges we‚Äôre facing, new learnings and discuss anything SaaS related. üç∑üßÄüíª The goal of this even is to have this monthly as a recurring event the last Wednesday each month to allow us all to meet regularly and to strengthen our SaaS community in Malm√∂. We‚Äôll start with quick round of presentations of the attendees at 16:30 so please be on time if you plan to attend so you can get to know others üëç Then we‚Äôll continue discussing anything SaaS related, either as a mini mastermind or freely depending on how many people show up. The plan is to go on until 18:30 for the official meetup but you are of course allowed to stay longer if you want to continue talking churn, MRR or DOCG. üòÄ 16:30 - Starts, presentation of attendees üëã18:30 - End of official event18:30‚Äî> - People who wants can stay longer and enjoy more wine üç∑ Hope to see you there!

description: How to create engaging experiences and what will it do to our perception and understanding of UI/UX design. We will look at the changes that will come with the emerging technologies, like AR. Web-AR, VR and Spacial computing in general and how AR and AR-glasses combined with 5G and edge computing. How Snap Chat, Instagram and Facebook is already driving the industry‚Ä¶.  Web authoring tools making it easier and more accessible. Speaker: Niels √òstergaard - Niels specialized in applying new technologies to visual communication and design, always with a goal of simplifying and converting complex knowledge into easy-to-understand communication.+20 years of experience working UI/UX and app development and with extensive knowledge in a wide variety of 3D software, producing/developing 3D animation, real-time 3D graphics and XR (AR/VR) solutions. Agenda: 17.30 ‚Äì Meet & Greet 17.45 ‚Äì Presentation 18.30 ‚Äì Meet & Eat 19.00 ‚Äì Q&A

name: Let‚Äôs take care of our own garbage, it can‚Äôt be that hard right? The why and what of Rust.
description: Rust is a programming language that is often talked about but not as well used as other programming languages. It‚Äôs a language that takes a different approach to memory management. It has no garbage collector, yet leaves no leaks. Imagine a green and flowery garden! It grows and it shines with color in the sunlight. If the weeds are the memory leaks, how would you keep it tidy? Through planting the correct plants together and inviting some insects, or by hiring a gardener? Rust is a natural way of keeping the weeds out without the need for a garbage collector or gardener In this case. But what is Rust and why should we use it? Speaker: Alexander - Alexander is a consultant Software developer that works for One Agency and his assignement is at BIMobject as a backend developer. He‚Äôs extrovert and energetic, with a passion for delivering beautiful and performant code! Agenda: 17.30 ‚Äì Meet & Greet 17.45 ‚Äì The why and what of Rust 18.30 ‚Äì Meet & Eat 19.00 ‚Äì Q&A

name: by entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs
description: There‚Äôs never been a better time to get started Do you have a great business idea but don‚Äôt know how to take it to the next level? Come and talk with experienced entrepreneurs at Startup Dojo. Test you ideas, get advice, enhance your pitch, find co-founders and investors, or just be inspired by your fellow entrepreneurs. Objective To help more people become (successful) startup entrepreneurs. Principles By entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs A Startup Dojo is where entrepreneurs meet to help each other become more successful in their startup ventures. If you are not an entrepreneur, nor wanting to become one, you have no business in the dojo. Iteration through Build-Measure-Learn ‚ÄúStep one is to have a strong vision. You must then test that vision against reality, and then decide whether to pivot or preserve.‚Äù ‚Äì Eric Ries, author of the book The Lean Startup Start with a Minimum Viable Product A Minimum Viable Product has just those features that allow the product to be deployed, and no more. Ideas are nothing without execution And the only way to achieve great execution is to talk about your ideas and get feedback along the way. Just do it! There is always a way. The only thing stopping you is your own mine. Mentors: Erik Starck David Degbor Jacob Gunge We will meet one per month. Welcome Agenda: 17.30- Meet & Greet 17.45- Presentation 18.30- Meet & Eat 19.00- Q&A

name: Coaching Test
description: Just as many companies shifted from test team to including the tester within the development team, now more and more companies are shifting to using testers as coaches for the teams instead. This shift requires new skills and new mindset from the testers when they no longer does the hands-on testing but instead guide the developers on how to think about good testing. So what does this actually mean for testers? What skills do we need to pickup or polish? Is this the future or just the latest buzz? We will go back to the Contest roots and do a classic style were anyone that wants does a 5min lightning talk about their experience or thoughts around the topic of coaching followed by facilitated discussions. The 5min talk doesn‚Äôt have to be something you share it can also be used to formulate a burning question you have. Agenda: 17:30 ‚Äì 17:45 Meet & Greet 17:45 ‚Äì 18:30 Lightning talks 18:30 ‚Äì 19:00 Pizza break 19:00 ‚Äì 20:00 Lightning talks continues Pizza and beer is served by tonight‚Äôs sponsor

name: Who will guard the guards themselves? How to trust your automation and avoid deceit
description: For teams and organizations moving towards a Continuous Delivery or Continuous Deployment model, automated tests are often the only gatekeeper before software is put into production. But can your automation be trusted enough to play this important role in the software development and delivery process? And what can you do to make sure your automation can be trusted enough to be relied on? In this talk, we'll take a look at trust and confidence with regards to test automation. You'll see a number of ways in which test automation can deceive you, why and how trust in test automation is lost and how to build tests you can trust on. We'll also take a closer look at mutation testing, a technique that can be used to verify that your automated (unit) tests actually do what they're supposed to do. In a live demo, you'll see what kind of information mutation testing can give you and how that compares to regularly used unit testing metrics like statement and branch coverage. You'll walk away from this talk with insights into what makes test automation reliable, how your test results can deceive you, as well as some practical tips on how to improve trust in your test automation. Speaker: Bas Dijkstra - Freelance test automation trainer and consultant.  https://www.linkedin.com/in/basdijkstra Agenda: 17:30 ‚Äì 17:45 ‚Äì Meet & Greet 17:45 ‚Äì 18:30 ‚Äì Presentation 18:30 ‚Äì 19:00 ‚Äì Meet & eat 19:00 ‚Äì 20:00 ‚Äì Q&A

name: If everything seems under control, you‚Äôre just not going fast enough
description: Ever wonder what you need to do to make your code run faster? Ever wondered how to become a ‚Äúperformance engineer‚Äù? Perhaps you do performance from time to time, in between one failure to the next severity 1 incident? And you have that strange feeling that you are doing it wrong? Perhaps you‚Äôve never bothered to see how fast your code works. Or maybe it‚Äôs just difficult to admit that you don‚Äôt know how to improve your code? It has been known for centuries that this is always a database problem (or someone else‚Äôs problem) ;). During this presentation, you will learn how to become a programmer aware of the performance of your code. We will focus not only on tools like JMH. JFR and flamegraphs, but also on the process of optimizing performance. We will talk about how good quality, so-called ‚Äúclean code‚Äù affects performance, why the data sets you use to benchmark your code are key to success, and when more does not mean faster.During the whole presentation, we will refactor and improve one, not-so-trivial example ‚Äì something that all of us know, like and know how to implement.‚ÄúBenchmark, profile, refactor, repeat‚Äù Speaker: Jarek Palka - Jarek has worked for more than 20 years in the IT industry, as a database administrator, programmer, architect, manager, and ‚Äúonsite disaster engineer‚Äù. He has taken part in small, medium, and nonsensically-large projects using all different processes, including waterfall, agile and no process whatsoever, always with the same effect. This led him to the conclusion that it doesn‚Äôt matter what you do, as long as you do it in the simplest possible way, and use the right tools to do the work for you. Recently, he‚Äôs been spending too much time exploring JVM‚Äôs best kept secrets, reading about managed runtimes, parsers and interpreters, and writing his own virtual machine. From time to time, you can hear his low-quality jokes about architecture and programming at conferences in Poland. He is also the author of a blog, http://geekyprimitives.com/, and is one of the founders of the SegFault conferences brand as well as a full-time benchmarking infrastructure engineer at Neo4j. Agenda: 17:30 ‚Äì 17:45 Meet & Greet 17:45 ‚Äì 18:30 Presentation 18:30 ‚Äì 19:00 Pizza break 19:00 ‚Äì 20:00 Q&A

name: CI/CD Made easy with Atlassian Stack
description: During this lunch seminar, we will show why the Atlassian stack is the best Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery tool set on the market. The Atlassian CI/CD stack offers features that will make almost all processes easier, faster, automated and will have people more involved from the first planning phases all the way to deployment. In this presentation we will show you how each tool benefits from one another and how easy it is to plan, communicate, automate and develop any type of project or process from simple office organization tasks to major software releases. We will show that you can keep your entire development process, from start to finish, under a single roof where no information or code will be lost and how you can save time by letting the tools do the work for you. We will discuss: The Atlassian CI/CD Model ‚Äì Infinity Cycle Understand each tool from the Atlassian stack Ease of collaboration Ease of continuous development High overview of the Atlassian ecosystem Register now and don‚Äôt miss this inspiring lunch seminar! Time and place: When: Thursday, 19 March at 11:30-13:00. Lunch is served from 11:30 and the seminar begins at 12:00. Where: Bricks Eatery, Mobilv√§gen 12, Lund | Venue ‚ÄúOktagonen‚Äù How: Please register no later than 17 March. The seminar will be in English. About the speaker: Igor Totic, Senior System Engineer, Seavus 7 years in IT support and DevOps 4 years primary focus on Atlassian products Certified in Atlassian Jira Administration and Jira Project Administration Worked with clients in logistics, finance and banking, IT and pharmaceuticals

name: Introducing Jenkins X

venue.name: Foo Cafe

description: Abstract: Jenkins X is a project which rethinks how developers interact with CI/CD in the cloud. Its focus lies on making development teams productive through automation, tooling and DevOps best practices. As developer you can type one command like jx create or jx import and get your source code, git repository and application created, automatically built and deployed to Kubernetes on each pull request complete with Environments and promotion via GitOps. Let's see how! Bio: Hardy Ferentschik - Polyglot software craftsman with deep roots in the Open Source community. Currently working for CloudBees on Jenkins X, the Open Source CI/CD solution for Kubernetes.Agenda: 17:30 - 17:45 Meet & Greet 17:45 - 18:30 Introducing Jenkins X 18:30 - 18:50 Pizza&Drinks 18:50 - 19:50 QA/Continue Discussion

name: Time-to-Event Analytics: Probabilistic Programming with R and Stan
description: This workshop is a follow-up to the presentation delivered by Noah Schellenberg and Andrew Segar at FooCafe in January 2020. Time-to-Event (TtE) Analytics is an especially important concept when performing survival analysis. The unique aspect of TtE Analytics is the use of the suspensions or right-censored data. We will review key messages from the talk in January and together work through the examples and exercises in R and Stan. There will be time for questions and discussions at the end of the workshop session. The workshop is aiming the users with an intermediate level of R proficiency. Basic familiarity with Bayesian methods and probabilistic modelling is encouraged, but not strictly required. About the Speakers: Noah Schellenberg is a Manager in the newly developed Data Science Center of Excellence at Tetra Pak. Previously he held positions as a Lead Data Scientist at Think Big Analytics, a Teradata Company and Principle Expert Engineer at Siemens Wind Power. Andrew Segar is a Data Scientist at Tetra Pak with expertise in TtE Analytics using R. This event is co-hosted with FooCafe, Malm√∂. Please RSVP your spot here:

name: Global Azure 2020
description: Sk√•ne Azure Usergroup is excited to invite you to the Global Azure 2020 on April 25. This is an event you mustn‚Äôt miss if you are working with Azure or plan to work with Azure! Be prepared for exciting presentations and demos about sizzling hot new technologies. *** The agenda and speakers will be announced later. *** We look forward to seeing you! Sk√•ne Azure User Group
